name: payment
summary: Records individual payment transactions made by customers for rentals.
purpose: To meticulously log financial transactions within the system, detailing which customer made a payment, for which rental, and which staff member processed it, along with the amount and date. This table is crucial for financial auditing and tracking revenue related to rentals.
dependencies_thoughts: This table acts as a transactional record, implicitly relating to the `customer` table via `customer_id`, the `staff` table via `staff_id`, and the `rental` table via `rental_id`. While explicit foreign key constraints are not defined, these columns are clearly intended to link to their respective parent tables.

columns.description: A unique, auto-incrementing identifier for each payment transaction. It forms part of the composite primary key.
The identifier of the customer who made the payment. This is an inferred foreign key referencing the 'customer' table.
The identifier of the staff member who processed the payment. This is an inferred foreign key referencing the 'staff' table.
The identifier of the rental transaction for which this payment was made. This is an inferred foreign key referencing the 'rental' table.
The monetary value of the payment, stored with a precision of two decimal places.
The timestamp with time zone indicating the exact date and time the payment was recorded. It forms part of the composite primary key.
